ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learnt about the history of the beach boys, their place in American pop culture
Gained a better understanding of popular music theory, how the countercultural movement of the 1960s and 70s interacted with pop, and learned to better analyze music biography.
This course gave insight into the musical and personal development of the prominent American band The Beach Boys.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
it was engaging and interactive 
could be more varied content

I think the main thing that could have improved the course would be musical theory. There was no formal prerequisites to taking the course, so everyone had vastly different musical backgrounds. It might have been better if everyone came in with a shared knowledge and we could discuss some of the concepts in more depth.
Everything about this class was a strength. The only weakness is that the course would have been even better in person, but that obviously was not possible during COVID.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: This course maximized the ability to teach and learn during the pandemic more than any other course I have taken in the past year. The discussions were still very engaging, the guest speakers were phenomenal, and there was always an u deters ding of students fatigue, allowing for breaks or pauses when necessary.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Only if you like the Beach Boys.

I would recommend this course to almost any student at yale. It is the perfect balance between technical musical analysis and music history, allowing students from any background to thrive in the class.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Reading and listening assignments, as well as documentary films.
